holidays.name: National Thrift Shop Day
holidays.description: A day dedicated to celebrating thrifting, where you scour thrift stores to find unique, affordable gems and support sustainable shopping.
holidays.origin: Originating in the USA, this day encourages reducing waste by buying second-hand clothing and goods.
holidays.funFact: Thrift shops have helped launch the flea market fashion trend and have been a favorite hangout spot for fashion icons looking for vintage treasures.

holidays.name: Black Cat Appreciation Day
holidays.description: A quirky day to honor and appreciate the mysterious charm of black cats, often misunderstood and surrounded by superstition.
holidays.origin: Started by cat lovers to dispel myths and celebrate these sleek feline friends.
holidays.funFact: Black cats are considered good luck in Scotland and Japan, contrary to the common superstition that they bring bad luck.

holidays.name: World Honey Bee Day
holidays.description: An event dedicated to raising awareness about the importance of honey bees to our ecosystem and food supply.
holidays.origin: Established by apiarists and environmental activists to highlight the critical role bees play in pollination worldwide.
holidays.funFact: Honey bees must collect nectar from about 2 million flowers to make 1 pound of honey!

holidays.name: National Roller Coaster Day
holidays.description: A thrilling day celebrating the exhilarating joy of roller coaster rides and amusement park adventures.
holidays.origin: This unofficial holiday marks the anniversary of the first roller coaster patent granted in the USA in the late 1800s.
holidays.funFact: The tallest roller coaster in the world reaches heights over 450 feet, making your stomach drop and your heart race in seconds!
